synopsis: In this insightful episode, Devam and Ahir delve into the complexities of anxiety, sharing personal experiences and reflections on how it has shaped their lives. They explore the importance of embracing emotions, the journey of self-acceptance, and the value of open conversations about mental health, all while maintaining a light-hearted and relatable tone.
quotes: You don't have to be defined by your anxiety; it can be a part of your journey, not the destination.
It's like carrying a ball and chain your entire life and not realizing the weight until you start to set it down.
Every day gets a little easier, but you got to do it every day—that's the hard part.
It's not about being free from anxiety; it's about learning to dance with it.
The anxiety is a fog, and that part of you that knows what's actually going on is underneath that fog.
Sometimes, the hardest part is just being able to accept that the feelings are there.
You can’t control everything, but you can control how you respond to those feelings.
When it gets really bad, I can still live my life to so much more of an extent that I want to.
We need to embrace our sadness; it’s a natural part of being human.
Like a workout for the mind, engaging with your feelings makes you stronger.
